question: The “Imprint India” initiative launched by Indian government:
option1: seeks to develop a road map for research to solve major engineering and technology challenges in country
option2: aims to provide government services online, expand Internet connectivity to rural areas
option3: envisages to create a framework to make school books accessible in digital form as e-books to be read and used on tablets and laptops
option4: aims at tapping the talent pool of Scientist and Entrepreneur Internationally to encourage their engagement with the institutes of higher Education in India
answer: seeks to develop a road map for research to solve major engineering and technology challenges in country
explanation: First option is the correct answer.IMPRINT INDIA is the joint initiative of IIT’s and IISC to give boost to scientifuc research within the country. IMPRINT India will focus on ten themes with each to be coordinated by one IIT/IISc, namely computer science and ICT (IIT Kharagpur), health care (IIT Kharagpur), advance materials, (IIT Kanpur), sustainable urban design (IIT Roorkee), water resources and river systems (IIT Kanpur), defence (IIT Madras), environmental science and climate change ( IISc, Bangalore), manufacturing(IIT Madras), nano-technology hardware (IIT Bombay) and energy security (IIT Bombay).
